description.narrative: The project aims at solving corporate responsibility (CR) challenges and finding new opportunities for both global development and business growth by encouraging strategic multi-stakeholder partnerships between companies and NGOs. The recruited companies i dentify their most material CR challenges and begin to tackle them in cooperation with selected NGOs. These business-NGO pairs will be brought together in a set of three facilitated workshops to further develop and concretize their ideas. Another project f unction is to help companies assess and manage their human rights impacts and risks and integrate human rights more tightly to their business operations by organizing a set of human rights training to middle-sized and state-owned companies .FIBS organized a similar human rights training in the previous VGK-round and the lessons learned and results of the previous training will applied in the next round. As part of the previous VGK-round FIBS published a Responsible Business in Developing Markets ?handbook t hat will be distributed to new audiences (small and middle-sized companies) as part of the new project. A conclusive video of the handbook will be produced to attract new audiences.Furthermore the project aims at producing a thorough study on the actual so cio-economic impacts of Finnish businesses in the developing world and on the ways to measure those impacts. In practical terms FIBS organizes seminars and researches the topic in tight co-operation with relevant partners (especially big companies NGOs).It was established in the previous project that most of the Finnish media representatives are still lacking information on CR-related issues. Therefore this project aims at training representatives of different media channels about the background challenges and possibilities of CR as objectively as possible by organizing a training course aimed at media personnel.
